intro: Hemizygia elliottii, commonly known as Elliott's hemizygia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Hemizygia elliottii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper underground.
